note: λαγαρός ‘slack, thin’, ON slakr, OIr. lac, etc. all meaning ‘slack’ (see Beekes 2010:819–20); ναίω ‘live, inhabit’ (Hom.) possibly < *nas-ye/o-, cf. aor. ἔνασσα (see Beekes 2010:994).

Lyc. etc.) < *owdas-(i)ye/o- beside ο( ὐδας (n.) ‘ground, soil’ (Hom.). αἰδοῖος < *aydos-(i)yo-s ‘inspiring αἰδώς’ (for possible comparative evidence, see Beekes 2010:34); γελοῖος ‘laughable’ *gelos-(i)ye/o-, beside s-stem γέλως, (-ωτος) < *gelH2 -os, cf. Arm. całr ‘laughter’ (see Beekes 2010:264–5);77 ἠοῖος (Hom., Hdt.), Dor. α ̓οῖος, Att. ἑῷος, Myc. a-wo-i-jo ‘of the morning, eastern’ < *awsos-(i)ye/o-, from the s-stem *awsos (> Hom. ἕως etc.). perf. pple f. -υια < *-us-ya.78
